thread.title: VSU soccer suffers last-minute loss to Union
thread.title_full: VSU soccer suffers last-minute loss to Union

author: Staff Reports
title: VSU soccer suffers last-minute loss to Union
text:
VSU soccer suffers last-minute loss to Union Staff Reports Valdosta Daily Times 
The Valdosta State soccer team suffered a heartbreaking 2-1 loss to Union in Gulf South Conference action on the road Saturday afternoon in Jackson, Tenn. 
After a promising start by the Blazers (3-8-2, 2-5-1 GSC) in the midfield, the team of head coach Rebecca Nolin generated the first corner of the game in the eighth minute. When Ava Scott-Moncrief delivered a perfect corner to Shelby Jennings, who converted with a delightful header, the Blazers took the lead, 1-0. 
After the first goal of the game, the Bulldogs (4-9-1, 4-3-1 GSC) looked to bounce back immediately. Union’s best striker,Honeye Heydari, took a risky shot on VSU’s goal at the 7:18 minute mark, but goalkeeper McCall Gardner proved to be too strong. 
The attempt sparked a flurry of offensive attempts by Union. During the first half, the Bulldogs compiled ten shots, which challenged Gardner for five of her eight saves on the night. 
The pressure on VSU’s goal continued in the second half, but the defensive performance by the Blazers held strong until the final two minutes. 
With only 1:30 left in the game, Georgia Hopkins scored her first goal with an outstanding shot from outside the 18-yard box. The Bulldogs used the momentum to set up one more chance in the box at the 89:28 mark, and Heydari stuck a ball into the far corner of the net to give Union the lead with only 32 seconds left in the game. The Blazers were not able to respond and ran out of time, resulting in the heartbreaking 2-1 defeat. 
Valdosta State’s next matchup will be another road trip to Carrolton, where the Blazers will take on conference foe West Georgia on Tuesday at 7 p.m. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
